quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Author and Playwright
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who wrote It is completely unimportant. That is why it is so interesting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agatha Christie

questions.question: Name the playwright who wrote The Second Man, End of Summer, No Time for Comedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: S. N. Behrman

questions.question: What famous playwright wrote Pygmalion, John Bulls Other Island, The Doctors Dilemma, Man and Superman, Candida?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bernard Shaw

questions.question: Which playwright wrote Riders to the Sea, The Tinkers Wedding, The Playboy of the Western World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. M. Synge

questions.question: Line, The Indian Wants the Bronx and Park Your Car in Harvard Yard were written by this playwright.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel Horvitz

questions.question: Who said Every radish I ever pulled up seemed to have a mortgage attached to it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Wynn

questions.question: Who wrote the plays Widowers Houses, The Devils Disciple, Mrs. Warrens Profession, Back to Methuselah and You Never Can Tell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bernard Shaw

questions.question: Name the author of The Dwarfs, The Homecoming, No Mans Land and The Caretaker.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harold Pinter

questions.question: Who wrote Time and the Conways, Dangerous Corner and The Inspector Calls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: J. B. Priestly

questions.question: Name the author of The Childrens Hour, The Little Foxes, Watch on Rhine and Toys in the Attic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lillian Hellman

questions.question: Torch Song Trilogy, Safe Sex, Spookhouse, The Catered Affair are plays by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvey Fierstein

questions.question: The Importance of Being Ernest, A Woman of No Importance, An Ideal Husband are plays by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Wilde

questions.question: The Dutchess of Malfi, Northward Ho!, Westward Ho!, and The White Devil are plays by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Webster

questions.question: Who wrote The female knee is a joint and not an entertainment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Percy Hammond

questions.question: Who is the author of Woman and Whisky, The Rat Trap, The Better Half, Blithe Spirit, Ill Leave It to You?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noel Coward

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Jacqueline Kennedy and Goals
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, people, grape. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who said You aint heard nothin yet, folks?

questions.question: Who wrote Imitation is the sincerest of flattery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Caleb Colton

questions.question: Who was the 2006-2007 Bowl Championship Series team winner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florida Gators

questions.question: Who said From the sublime to the ridiculous is but a step?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte

questions.question: What was Jacqueline Kennedys maiden name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bouvier

questions.question: Where was Jacqueline Kennedy born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southampton, New York

questions.question: Who wrote Indeed, I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: On February 24, 1982, ice hockey player Wayne Gretzky broke the record for most goals in a season, by scoring 76 goals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What NFL team won the 1999 Super Bowl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denver Broncos

questions.question: Who wrote Then conquer we must, for our cause it is just?

questions.question: What was Jacqueline Kennedys occupation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Book Editor

questions.question: Which player was given the Calder Cup trophy in the 2005-2006 NHL season?

questions.question: Jacqueline Kennedy graduated from George Washington University with a bachelor of arts degree in French literature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who wrote You might as well fall flat on your face as lean over too far backward?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Thurber

questions.question: Who said Beulah, peel me a grape?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mae West

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Jacqueline and Jacqueline Kennedy
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, franks. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How old was Alexander the Great of Macedonia when he died?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 32

questions.question: Where did Jacqueline and John F. Kennedy honeymoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Acapulco, Mexico

questions.question: What did Jacqueline Kennedy do after her husbands assassination?

options.text: She refused to remove her blood-stained clothing.
She removed her wedding ring and slipped it onto the Presidents finger.
She told aide Ken ODonnell, Now I have nothing left.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Jacqueline Kennedy became First Lady at the age of 31.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the name of the largest empire in pre-Columbian America, ruled by Huayna Capac?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inca

questions.question: Which King of the Franks was also crowned Roman Emperor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles I the Great (Charlemagne)

questions.question: Which ruler is considered the founder of the great Persian Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cyrus the Great

questions.question: This empire was ruled by Franz Joseph I for 68 years and was dissolved 2 years after his death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Austria-Hungary

questions.question: What happened after Jacqueline Kennedys marriage to shipping magnate Aristotle Onassis ?

options.text: She lost her Secret Service protection.
She became the target of paparazzi.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Jacqueline and John F. Kennedy had four children together.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: After Onassis death, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis accepted from Onassiss daughter, Christina, a settlement of $26,000,000.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Shaka was a king of the Zulu Empire. Where was it situated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: Who was the first Emperor of the Holy Roman Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Otto I

questions.question: Which Egyptian Pharaoh was named The Great Ancestor by his successors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ramses II

questions.question: Around the year 1200 AD a chieftain, called Temüjin, united tribes between Manchuria and Altai mountains and thus started one of the biggest empires in the world history. By what name is Temüjin better known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genghis Khan

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Moonlight
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, franks. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This was the last movie in which Anna Nicole Smith appeared and was released after her death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Illegal Aliens

questions.question: What popular actor and musician once said, The truth leaves a repairable cut, but a lie leaves a jagged wound. It doesnt easily heal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Will Smith

questions.question: What was the name of Anne Franks (12 June 1929 - March 1945) diary when it was first published in English in 1952?

options.text: The Diary of a Young Girl

questions.question: What is the final part of this quote by Cameron Diaz, I dont believe that you should make fun of anyone but ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yourself

questions.question: Dutch singer Anita Doth is popular as part of what group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 Unlimited

questions.question: In what 2000 movie did LeAnn Rimes appear as herself, singing her song Cant Fight the Moonlight?

options.text: Holly Hobbie and Friends: Christmas Wishes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coyote Ugly

questions.question: Actress Anne Hathaway has claimed that this Academy Award-winning actress is her idol and inspiration.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meryl Streep

questions.question: What comedian did actress and director Anne Heche date for two years, earlier in her career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Martin

questions.question: Which of these great women was a monarch for the longest period of time?

options.text: Tsaritsa Catherine II the Great of Russia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Victoria of Great Britain

questions.question: Who came up with the stage name Tina Turner in the beginning of Anna Mae Bullocks career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her husband Ike

questions.question: Who does the following quote belong to: Everyone wants to ride in the limo - you want someone wholl take the bus with you if the limo breaks down?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oprah Winfrey

questions.question: What famous American rapper once said, When you live your life afraid to die, youre afraid to live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 50 Cent

questions.question: What popular male singer did Russian tennis player and model Anna Kournikova start dating in 2001?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enrique Iglesias

questions.question: Anne Boleyn was the second wife of Henry VIII of England and mother of this great English Queen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Elizabeth I

questions.question: Who was Saint Anne, also known as Hannah, according to Christian and Muslim tradition?

options.text: The mother of the Virgin Mary

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The mother of the Virgin Mary

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Quote and Switzerland
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, puzzles. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What American actress and model once said, Nobody is tough and strong all the time. To say that is to deny human emotion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liv Tyler

questions.question: What is the missing part from this quote by Keanu Reeves: The simple act of ... can take you a long way?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: paying attention

questions.question: What famous American actress came up with this quote: I find the less you focus on your flaws, the better off you are. Be yourself, and be glad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michelle Pfeiffer

questions.question: Who said the following: Its distancing when people say they dont have problems. Lifes about messing up and getting on your feet again?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debra Messing

questions.question: He was born outside of Bern in 1879 and studied art throughout Europe. His style is difficult to classify as his works show cubist, surrealist, and expressionistic aspects. Perhaps his most famous painting is of a cat.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Klee

questions.question: What is the missing word from this statement made by Jada Pinkett Smith: What makes you valuable is your ..., and how you present yourself to the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart

questions.question: This Swiss family just churned out great mathematicians in the 17th and 18th Centuries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bernoulli

questions.question: This Swiss Miss portrayed Honey Ryder in the James Bond movie Dr. No.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ursula Andress

questions.question: This person, born in Geneva in 1896, is most famous as an expert in developmental psychology.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean Piaget

questions.question: Who does this quote belong to: Strength doesnt come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Schwarzenegger

questions.question: He was a Swiss-born mathematician who invented what we now call Sudoku puzzles. He is known as the most prolific mathematician although he was blind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Euler

questions.question: He was born Charles Edouard Jeanneret in 1887 in Switzerland. He became one of the worlds greatest and most famous architects, championing the International Style. What pseudonym did he adopt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Le Corbusier

questions.question: This man was appointed to the rare rank of General of the Swiss Army during World War II.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henri Guisan

questions.question: Although he is best known as a leader of the French revolution, this man was born in Switzerland. Jacques Louis-Davids 1793 painting depicts his murder in a bathtub.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marat

questions.question: This tennis great was born in 1981 in Basil.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Federer

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Street and Husband
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, mimes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Lady Bird Johnson was on board Air Force One when her husband was sworn as the 36th president of the U.S. after the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This guitarist, who received a B.A. in music from Princeton University, played on New York City street corners for many years until being discovered.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stanley Jordan

questions.question: Eleanor Roosevelt did not become politically active until her husband was elected president.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Although his cars are American, this carmaker was born in Switzerland in 1878.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chevrolet

questions.question: Which of these was a landmark case legalizing street performers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davenport v. City of Alexandria

questions.question: This Swiss family boasts at least three generations of balloonists and inventors. What is their last name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piccard

questions.question: What was the nickname of President Warren Hardings wife, Florence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fossie

questions.question: What was Theodore Roosevelts wifes first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edith

questions.question: Which of the following words means a street performer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Busker

questions.question: Which one of the following is famous for running a school for mimes in New York City ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gregg Goldston

questions.question: This great sculptor was born in Borgonovo in 1901. His work Grande Femme Debout II was bought in 2008 for $27,4000,00.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giacometti

questions.question: This group, formed in 1972 by Bernie Schurch, Andre Bossier and Floriano Frassetto, featured mime with bizarre masks and an innovative use of light and shadow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mummenschanz

questions.question: Which statement is true about Oofty Goofty, a famous street performer in San Francisco?

options.text: He claimed to be a mime yet did nothing but  talk.
He performed famous Shakespearean speeches on the streets of San Francisco.
By day he played oldies on the street and at night performed at the Filmore East.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was a professional masochist.

questions.question: Which of these cities hosts an international street performers festival each year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmonton, Canada

questions.question: Which French performer and mime is famous for his character Bip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marcel Marceau
